messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: NEW unschooling thread was2213 NEA vs homeschool...
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/9/02 7:04:21 AM Central Daylight Time, ... Don t forget the Little House books by Laura Ingalls Wilder, the Boxcar Children series, Betsy,
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/9/02 7:04:21 AM Central Daylight Time,
ElissaJC@... writes:


> Question:
> DD is 8 1/2 and just starting to read. She is interested in easy books but
> our problem is the subject matter of said books. They are all about little
> kid topics, starting kindegarten, babyish pictures, etc. Does anyone have
> ideas on easy readers that are a little more interesting for tweens? (That
> would inolve babysitting, horses or Mary Kate and Ashley? LOL )
> ~Elissa Cleaveland

Don't forget the Little House books by Laura Ingalls Wilder, the Boxcar
Children series, Betsy, Tacy and Tib books by Maude Hart Lovelace, A series
of Unfortunate Events by Lemony Snicket (This series might be one to read
after or at the same time a child is ready to read books like Harry Potter.)
Moly has loved all these books, she is currently working her way through the
Lemony Snicket books.
~Nancy


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
